column4: na basically ALSA made counter strike source crash, and the old OSS drivers didnt provide any sound
so i decided to update OSS, i can get sound in counter strike now with OSS but its all crackled and stuff, and nothing else has sound
Have you tried re-installed ALSA and then restarting?
When you restart ALSA (   sudo /etc/init.d/alsa-utils restart  ) do you receive any error messages?
And in System -> Preferences -> Sounds, you've selected ALSA for everything?
What do you get from ` groups `
sumsha adm dialout cdrom plugdev lpadmin admin sambashare
Try joining the audio group;   usermod -a -G audio <username>
Then log out and log back in.
thanks, brb ill logout and come back in here
How about  ` sudo modprobe snd-hda-intel `; it still give you the same error?
